definition: quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Service has got slower, waiting times longer.
sentences.chinese: 审判工作越发缓慢，原被告双方等待时间也更漫长。

sentences.english: The defendants were the subject of the original decision said.
sentences.chinese: 原被告均表示服从判决。

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
examination of the evidence of the opposing party in a court of law
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
to mediate/to bring parties to an agreement
appellee (side that won in trial court, whose victory is being appealed by losing side)
